isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 5 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS SPICER ES62-5A, ES62-5D, ES67-5A AND ES67-5D - REASSEMBLY - CASE

step1.para: Use a hoist to install the countershaft assembly into the case ( Figure 56). Use the proper driver to install the front and rear countershaft bearing races.

figure.caption: Figure 56. Install Countershaft Assembly into Case

step1.para: Position the reverse idler gear and thrust washers in the case ( Figure 57). Use a rubber mallet to install the idler shaft with the flat side facing the bearing cap.

figure.caption: Figure 57. Position Reverse Idler Gear and Thrust Washers in Case

step1.para: Assemble the countershaft rear bearing cap and shims ( Figure 58), but do not apply an anaerobic sealant until after end play is checked. Notice how the idler shaft and bearing cap align.

figure.caption: Figure 58. Assemble Countershaft Rear Bearing Cap and Shims

step1.para: Install the lubrication spacer into the countershaft front bearing bore ( Figure 59).

figure.caption: Figure 59. Install Spacer into Countershaft Front Bearing Bore

step1.para: Install the clutch housing and gasket ( Figure 60). Secure with bolts. Tighten to 120 to 150 ft-lbs. (163 to 203 N• m).

figure.caption: Figure 60. Install Clutch Housing and Gasket

step1.para: Check countershaft end play ( Figure 61). It must be set between .001 and .008 inch (.025 and .203 mm) for proper unit functioning. Adjustments can be made by re-shimming if necessary. Also re-install the rear countershaft bearing cap using purple Loctite 515® or equivalent. Secure with bolts. Tighten to 60 to 80 ft-lbs. (81 to 108 N• m).

Use a chain hoist to lift the mainshaft assembly into the case ( Figure 62). Install the bearing cap and gasket, making sure to align the oil passages with those in the case. Secure with bolts. Tighten to 60 to 80 ft-lbs. (81 to 108 N• m).

figure.caption: Figure 62. Use Chain Hoist to Lift Mainshaft Assembly into Case

step1.para: Lubricate the pocket bearing with Moly #2 lubricant ( Figure 63).

Install the input shaft, bearing cap, and gasket ( Figure 64). Make sure a protective sleeve is used to protect the bearing cap seal when sliding the cap over the shaft ( Figure 65). Secure with bolts. Tighten to 34 to 41 ft-lbs. (46 to 56 N• m).

figure.caption: Figure 64. Install Input Shaft, Bearing Cap, and Gasket

caution.para: Red sleeve must be used to prevent serious damage to oil seal when assembling bearing cap. Failure to comply will void seal warranty.

figure.caption: Figure 65. Make Sure Protective Sleeve is Used to Protect Bearing Cap Seal

step1.para: Install the end yoke, washer, and nut ( Figure 66). Tighten to 500 to 600 ft-lbs. (678 to 814 N• m).

figure.caption: Figure 66. Inspect End Yoke, Washer, and Nut

step1.para: Rotate the mainshaft to properly seat the bearings ( Figure 67). Place a dial indicator on the output shaft and lift shaft with pry bars. End play must be between .003 and .008 inch (.08 and .20 mm) to ensure proper unit functioning. If necessary, re-shim the output bearing cap to achieve proper end play.

figure.caption: Figure 67. Rotate Mainshaft to Seat Bearings

step1.para: Place all clutch gears in neutral. Install the shifter housing and gasket. Secure them with bolts ( Figure 68). Tighten to 20 to 30 ft-lbs. (27 to 41 N• m).

figure.caption: Figure 68. Install Shifter Housing and Gasket

step1.para: Insert the poppet balls and springs into the shifter housing ( Figure 69).

figure.caption: Figure 69. Insert Poppet Balls and Springs into Shifter Housing
